law.catch_line: Notice To Commissioner Of Commencement Or Change Of Location Of Business; Violations
law.text: [ Text of section effective until March 27, 2011. For text effective March 27, 2011, see below.] The owner of every factory, workshop, manufacturing, mechanical, mercantile or other establishment or industry in which twelve or more persons are employed shall, upon the commencement, or a change of location, of its operations within the commonwealth, give notice thereof to the commissioner in such form as the commissioner shall prescribe. Whoever knowingly violates this section shall be punished by a fine of not more than one hundred dollars, or by imprisonment for not more than two months, or both. Chapter 149: Notice to commissioner of commencement or change of location of business; violations [ Text of section as amended by 2011, 3, Secs. 132 and 133 effective March 27, 2011. For text effective until March 27, 2011, see above.] The owner of every factory, workshop, manufacturing, mechanical, mercantile or other establishment or industry in which twelve or more persons are employed shall, upon the commencement, or a change of location, of its operations within the commonwealth, give notice thereof to the commissioner of the department of career services in such form as the director of the department of labor standards shall prescribe. Whoever knowingly violates this section shall be punished by a fine of not more than one hundred dollars, or by imprisonment for not more than two months, or both.
